comment.author: 81594342@N00
comment._content:
What I find strange is that these are bare bones, after a battle what you get are corpses, with more or less flesh but corpses anyway. AFAIK the soldiers where buried in mass graves, this may be a mass grave but it's surely quite some time after the battle.

I would really like to know what story this document is telling... Another example of real life being weirder than any (mad) artist's dreams.

comment.author: 12306929@N04
comment._content:
To me the story told is that once life has disappeared from the body there is no distinction left just the substances that made up the living beings and is now totally inert, indistinguishable remains,no story, not history,no loving family,no children, no parents,just sadness and emptiness where love once dwelled-------the horror of war is that  so many lives are lost that  identity is removed and replaced with anonymity, so then grief expressed by the surviving relatives, friends, comrades-in-arms cannot be focused on a specific set of remains nor even sometimes the remains of one's particular side in the conflict !

            
----DEAD is just dead !----
